intro: Calophyllum dioscurii, commonly known as the black mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Clusiaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of the Americas, particularly in the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dark, almost black bark and its ability to thrive in saline and waterlogged soils. It has small, glossy, elliptical leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. Calophyllum dioscurii plays an important ecological role in coastal ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
